title: What Native American peoples lived near the Pilgrims? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: The Nipmuc, Narragansett, Wampanoag and several Abenaki bands live in the area settled by the colonizers. However, due to decimation by Old World diseases there were vast tracts in Wampanoag territories that were depopulated. This is where they established their initial settlements, as the indigenous people moved inland from the coastal plain. Primarily to avoid contracting illnesses, but also to escape enslavement by passing “fishing vessels”.

Massachusetts Indian Tribes and Languages The Wampanaog Indians lived in most of Eastern Massachuestts. The Patuxet people, specifically, inhabited the area where the Pilgrims set up shop. Patuxet - Wikipedia
